settings.question: Do I need to refrigerate?
settings.answer: Both our gochujang and ssamjang require refrigeration after opening. To extend shelf life, we also recommend storing your unopened gochujang and ssamjang in a cool, dry place.

settings.question: What is the shelf life?
settings.answer: Products will include a best by date on the bottom of the jars. Because our products are fermented, they will typically be good to use for 1-2 years after opening.

settings.question: Are your products gluten-free, vegan, or organic?
settings.answer: Our products are vegan and made from natural ingredients, which are grown in Korea without preservatives. Organic certification is an expensive undertaking that we have not undergone as a small business, and the small amount of malt that allows us to not add additional sugar does contain traces of gluten.

settings.question: Is your packaging recyclable?
settings.answer: We do our best to keep sustainability in mind. The boxes around our jars, aluminum lids, and shipping materials are all recyclable.

settings.question: What is your return policy?
settings.answer: Because of the nature of our products, we do not offer returns. If anything feels off about your order, donâ€™t hesitate to contact us at hello@potluckmarket.com.

settings.question: Where do you ship?
settings.answer: We currently ship within the United States.

settings.question: My order is delayed, missing or damaged. What do I do?
settings.answer: Oh no, sorry to hear that! Please contact us at hello@potluckmarket.com.

settings.question: Where can I find Potluck?
settings.answer:
You can purchase directly from our website or from a growing number of independent retailers across the country. Find us here!

settings.question: Can I stock Potluck in my store or restaurant?
settings.answer: Of course! We love working with independent retailers and local restaurants. Send us a note at hello@potluckmarket.com. We also take orders on Faire.
